node.text:
To save a shark from fishing gear or entanglement fills me with humble joy! ❤️ If you’ve been out with @oneoceandiving in the last week or two you might’ve seen this beautiful tiger shark #SharkIDGador with fishing line and a bunch of tackle on her. Tiger shark season has just started for us, although we see them year round, there is a significant increase in the # of tigers we see August through October. Tiger shark Gador swam by with around 100ft of line, it took multiple days and multiple tries, sometimes whichever One Ocean boat I was on when she passed by the knife was too rusty for the thick monofilament. The last cut I made this AM in the last clip was to remove the tackle that kept bothering and scarring her as it kept tucking in between her pectoral and side. 
It makes me sad to see the fishing gear bothering them and gouging away at their skin, I’m grateful to the people who have been coming out with us lately which helps facilitate the monitoring of the sharks and gives us a chance to help directly reduce human impacts, injuries, and possible mortality due to entanglement. 
Special thanks to my incredible safety team @oneoceandiving who regularly make great efforts to carefully remove entanglement from every shark they can & @juansharks filming and watching my back, @kylezaj for letting me use your personal knife since all our other ones on the boat were rusted, and my braddah @inahdm from @pelagicdivefuvahmulah of Maldives for being in the right place at the right time so we could be there to save Gador 🙌🏽🤙🏽 
Much gratitude and aloha for all the support from the community and those sharing their experiences with sharks along with an educational conservation minded message ❤️
Fishing line will be recycled and made into jewelry by @oneoceandiving @andriana_marine 

New wetsuit I designed with @xcelwetsuits #SaveTheReef #SaveTheOcean the red wetsuit with the coral design was made for world reef day to raise awareness for coral reefs but due to COVID related delays last year it won’t be released till spring 2022 ❤️ #Mahalo #ThankYou #HelpSaveSharks #RespectSharks #MalamaManō #MarineEntanglement #Discoversharks #xcelwetsuits #oneocean

node.text:
…did everything I teach people not to do, here is what it looks like and how to respond as the #OneOceanSeries continued…(Next one is going up on @Juansharks IG)

@JuanShaks and I have been working with sharks for 20+ years now, it’s fascinating to study their behavior and I cannot even convey how incredible it is to get to know them as individuals. 
It is because of those individual sharks and other marine creatures that my passion and drive to help save them is constantly renewed and why I share this information with the public and have trained so many other wonderful professionals @OneOceanDiving to be a voice for those without a voice, and to facilitate better interactions with the highest level of  awareness and experience through extensively applied techniques. 

**Disclaimer** This information builds off the information in my online course which is a visual taster of my book (links in bio,) however, sharks are important apex predators that need and deserve to be respected as such, so please do not attempt to recreate this.  I share this information because I want people to be more knowledgable, aware, and as safe as possible when they have the incredible experience of enjoying time with sharks under the guidance of an extensively trained and experienced professional guide. 

Speaking of extensively trained professional shark safety guides…@OneOceanDiving is now hiring people who have an unwavering passion for marine conservation, shark-strong work ethic/grit, and a very positive attitude PADI Divemasters or PADI professional freedive instructors who ideally have a degree related to marine science. Don’t worry, we teach you all about shark behavior and safety because there is no university or other course that will teach you this, but you do have to be exceptional in the water to pass the swim test, and very good at guiding other people in water. 

Watch the next episode @Juansharks iGTV and if you missed any they are on my website with links to my online course and book. Link in bio.  THANK YOU MAHALO NUI LOA @juansharks & Editor & videographer @jarebutter 🦈🙌🏽⚡️🦈🙏😊

node.text:
This information builds off of my book “What you should know about sharks.” 
It also builds off of the educational content in this same video format of my masters style class (link on my website) in addition to building on the other free “Advanced Shark Diver” video’s in the #OneOceanSeries So if you haven’t read the book, taken the online course, and watched the other free videos in this series it will be out of context. 
Important: 
***Disclaimer*** Please do not attempt to replicate this, I am sharing this information I hope someone could consider in an emergency but also for awareness for shark behavior and safety, because that is an important part of conservation. I want people to better understand and coexist with sharks and the best way to do that is to learn about them, their importance, maybe even to go snorkeling, scuba, or
Freediving with them with a very experienced and respectful professional guide, in order to spend time with them as safely as possible, and with as much personal awareness as possible. 

Sharks are absolutely INCREDIBLE, there is NOTHING like a shark, and each species has its own unique and beautiful presence, and each individual it’s own unique and fascinating personality. 

I see it everyday @oneoceandiving as people’s perceptions change from fear to fascination and respect, and that shift has inspired support for conservation efforts 💙🦈💙 
Thank you to those who support, & to my ❤️ love love @juansharks and to our very patient, professional, and extremely talented videographer and editor extraordinaire MR @jarebutter who put this together 🙌🏽 

@oneoceandiving @oneoceanresearch @oneoceanconservation 

#OneOcean #HelpSaveSharks #LearnAboutSharks #JuanSharks #malamamanō #discoversharks #learn #sharkdiving #sharkconservation #sharkresearch #sharkattack #sharkbite BAN #sharkfinsoup BAN #sharkfinning #openwater #oceanramsey #swimmingwithsharks #oneoceandiving

node.text:
Disclaimer this sub-series is more than 4 parts, the 2nd video will be released on @Juansharks IG next, however this information is meant to be used for emergencies only.  I want help people and sharks to coexist as safely and respectfully as possible and sometime that means giving them their space back and exiting the water, even if you’re extremely experienced working around them.  I generally only start to share this information with professional shark safety diver guides once they’ve already been working with sharks on a daily basis for an extended period of time, only those who have the water skill required to quickly and efficiently move themselves around in the water and adapt to a rapid approach and are trained to look in all directions continuously to see an approach or issue before it becomes a serious issue. I make it look easier than it is because I’ve done it a lot in many places around the world with many species and I’ve worked in the water daily for over two decades specifically for water safety and mostly always focused around sharks and studying their behavior. 

So, please be aware of your personal abilities a d respectful of them and choose to stay safe, don’t become complacent or assume every approach will be the same. 

Special mahalo nui loa (thank you so much) to my love @Juansharks for filming me and also to our editor @Jaredbutler for your incredible patience, many revisions, and beautiful talents shared. 
Learn the information this builds on by taking my online course and reading my book which covers much more information in detail. 
Link on my website along with more free video’s like this and links to my books. 
Thank you deeply/sincerely for your support and I hope everyone is busy in the best way possible this 2021 summer :) or winter down-undah 
If you’re afraid of sharks, love them, or don’t know much about them I would highly encourage you to watch @savingjawsmovie on @amazonprimevideo and @hulu and check out the soon to be released: @envoyfilm and #FinTheMovie on @discoveryplus

node.text:
Disclaimer this sub-series is more than 4 parts, the 2nd part of this I will release soon and the 2nd video segment will be released on @Juansharks IG next, however this information is meant to be used for emergencies only.  I want help people and sharks to coexist as safely and respectfully as possible and sometimes that means giving them their space back and exiting the water, even if you’re extremely experienced working around them.  I generally only start to share this information with professional shark safety diver guides once they’ve already been working with sharks on a daily basis for an extended period of time, only those who have the water skill required to quickly and efficiently move themselves in the water and adapt to a rapid approach and are trained to look in all directions continuously to see an approach or issue before it becomes a serious issue. I make deterring look easier than it is because I’ve done it a lot in many places around the world with many species and I’ve worked in the water daily for over two decades specifically for water safety and mostly always focused around sharks and studying their behavior. So, please be respectful of them and your own abilities/knowledge/experience and stay safe, don’t become complacent or assume every approach will be the same, they won’t be. Read my book “what you should know about sharks” for a lengthy explanation. 

Special mahalo nui loa (thank you so much) to my love @juansharks ❤️ for filming me and also to our editor @jarebutter for your incredible patience with editing and revisions, and beautiful talents shared for a cause #GratefulForYou. 

Learn more by staying tuned, taking my online course (Link on my website also with more free video’s like this) and links my books are also on my website: OceanRamsey.Org 

Thank you deeply/sincerely for your support and I hope everyone is busy in the best way possible this 2021 summer :) or winter down-undah

node.text:
We are mailing out prizes to people who do a nature cleanup tomorrow and post photos or a video & tag @oneoceanconservation & @savetheseaturtlesinternational 
Tag one or all of the prize brands to specify which prizes you want most. 
Giveaways include:
-Swiss lux watches from @luminoxworld 
-Free spots @oneoceandiving -Clothing by @oneoceandesigns & @clarklittleclothing & @juansharks
-Reusable water bottles from @hydroflask 
-sunscreen from @rawelementsusa 
-My “What you should know about sharks” book & my 1st children’s book 
-Our limited edition @savesharkschocolate dark chocolate 
-conservation sticker packs
-Jewelery from @weartoddy 
-A thirty minute professional photo shoot with the extremely talented @taylorrwalstonphoto who also edited this video & participated in this Reef clean up along with the extremely amazing (& also hilarious) @poorandindanger who rescued a fish that was caught and stuck suffering on an abandoned hook and line that was wrapped around the coral. I am so happy he got to swim away alive, a life directly saved from marine debris. 
One of the honu ( sea turtles) had a small hook & line in his “armpit” area, unfortunately we couldn’t cut the line any shorter. 

Thank you to everyone who makes efforts large and small to help reduce damaging human impacts on reefs, other marine life, & the ocean. 
Tag us in your efforts tomorrow and 20 winners will be selected. Please use the #WorldReefDay2021 & tag @oneoceanconservation & @savetheseaturtlesinternational & the brand of the prize from the list above on your photo or video tomorrow. 

#sealifesavingswim #savetheseaturtlesinternational #savethereef #coralgardeners #marinedebris #reefsafe #memorialdayweekend #coral #savetheocean

Vid edit @taylorrwalston for @oneoceanconservation @savetheseaturtlesinternational 💕❤️ Mahalo 💕💙🐢🦈🐬🐠

node.title: Win prizes! Do a clean up for world reef day tomorrow 💙🌊

node.text:
PLEASE TAKE ACTION NOW! A seemingly small action today really will help make a historical change to HELP SAVE SHARKS in Hawaii! We’ve been pretty quiet about this on social media til this point but it is now the FINAL step to getting sharks fully protected in Hawaii! 

Please lend them your voice by writing into to the Governor of Hawaii today via the link in the bio @oneoceanconservation and ask him to : “PROTECT SHARKS by please SUPPORTING and signing HB553 into law.”

The link is in the bio of @oneoceanconservation 

and I have a good feeling this is the year that manō (sharks) in Hawaii get the protection that they need, deserve, and traditionally were given.  Lets protect sharks everywhere we can and for me it’s significant to see the manō I have grown up with (who have taught me so much) get protection from purposeful killing, capture, entanglement, and harm. 

Video of Roxy, I’m grateful she seems to visit me around my birthday, the holidays, and when she needs debris like this net and fishing line removed.  This law will help to reduce nets in shark nursery habitats (nets like the ones we’ve cut off her several times) and hopefully save other sharks from broken jaws like hers as it will be a fineable offense to purposely (not accidentally) capture or kill a shark.  This law won’t criminalize accidental capture, but it will mean that fisherman must let a shark go if they realize they do accidentally capture a shark, which responsible fishermen already do. 

LINK IN BIO @OneOceanConservation PLEASE SUPPORT THE PROTECTION OF SHARKS TODAY. Mahalo nui loa. Malamamano Respect and protect sharks. 
Special thanks to the many organizations, individuals, reps, and senators who have been helping support this bill all along the way and for many years now. #ForManō #HelpSaveSharks #protectsharks #SaveTheOcean

node.title: Please write support hb553 save sharks in link of bio @oneoceanconservation

node.text:
Thank you to those helping to protect nature from the negative impacts of human kind. 
Thank you to those who have supported the recent conservation effort to help facilitate the switch for some families to become more eco-friendly, with water filters instead of plastic water bottles, in this extra special place #FuvahmulahIsland #TigerSharkIsland an island that many endangered and vulnerable species seem to love and live at year round 🦈🐢 

Sponsor a water filter or donate to the educational outreach and reef clean up supply efforts via @savetheseaturtlesinternational (link in bio) for @naturefriendsofmaldives Water filtration systems will be voluntarily installed by @pelagicdivefuvahmulah 

Special tanks to @cara.stober.driggers @oceanculturelife and #nortallana for the most recent water filters being sponsored along with @btwaves @mikecoots @hurawalhi @nakairesorts @nakaialimatharesort @aristonmaldives @oneoceandesigns who is also doing a fund raiser design of the local Tiger shark “Pirate” which is live now. 

Happy earth day 🌎 It’s a beautiful blue and green planet, let’s try our best to keep it that way 💙🌊🌴 

Edit by @jarebutter 🙌🏽🤙🏽💙🦈💙 We tried to catch this poor crow with plastic on his neck at the refuse pile but sadly couldn’t. While all the rest flew away he stayed and posed.......I don’t think it was coincidence, crows are pretty smart ❤️ I got the message, I hope more people do too 💙 

#Earthday #MakeAnImpact #InstagramForACause #ForACause #marineConservation #conservation #impact #water #waterfilter 

Support @savetheseaturtlesinternational 
Follow @pelagicdivefuvahmulah and help @naturefriendsofmaldives a buddying small local NGO effort for educational and nature to community connection

node.text:
Very excited to tell you more about the projects here soon but I wish everyone could meet the wonderful locals, both those above and below sea level 😊🦈. The team @PelagicdiveFuvahmulah is amazing and we've been loving working with them and enjoying the fascinating and unique dynamic of the tiger sharks we see all day here, in all sizes.  It is such a unique place in the world to see a healthy population of sharks, especially of tiger sharks.  Year round, for generations, they have coexisted and I can't wait to share more about the history, culture, and more conservation efforts from the locals perspective.  Please follow @pelagicdivefuvahmulah and help support them in their community nature connection and conservation projects they will be announcing soon. If you've never seen a tiger shark and want to guarantee you will this is the best place to go, just please please #RespectTheLocals the people, culture, sharks, and other marine life and take lots of photos but don't leave anything but good feelings and support in the ways you can. If you pack it in, please pack it out, the Maldives doesn't have infrastructure or much land to handle refuse. I will post more later about my experience and recommendations for local islands and other. Wishing you a Jawsome day. Video shot by @Jarebutter Love the edit by @jarebutter some footage from my #GoProHero9 @gopro and @juansharks @Canonusa 

#Tigersharks #helpsavesharks #Jarebutter #JaredButler #Juansharks #GoPro3000 #gopro #MaldivesSharks #SharksMaldives #SharksInMaldives #Divewithsharks #saveSharks #Local #LocalConservation #DivewithLocals #InternationalConservation #OneOceanGlobal #Coexist #Discoversharks #sharks #shark #Kind

node.title: So happy to be back with the locals @PelagicDiveFuvahmulah :). 🦈🦈

node.text:
Why sharks are important. A very kid friendly video that I challenge you to watch without falling asleep to the sound of my very sleepy voice 😴 Lol. I recorded this late at night months ago and a wonderful volunteer artist, Deborah B Hibler @thebusybeeeventspromotions whom I appreciate so much put this cute little animation together. 
Some very general information to share. Hope you enjoy! 
Find out more about ways to help save sharks by visiting OneOceanDiving.Com under the Conservation & research tab there are links to the top 10 ways to #HelpSaveSharks, the HelpSaveSharks letter link, and the volunteer page under Help Take Action. 
Thank you so much again to Deborah B. Hibler @Thebusybeeeventspromotions

If there are more animators out there who would be willing to help create different pieces on ocean conservation that are engaging for kids we would love your help. Please email: OneOceanDiving@gmail.com 

Thank you so much 🤗🙏🏼

node.title: Why sharks are important. Kid friendly 🐠🦈🐳

node.text:
Guess who took my @gopro 😂😍 Forever fascinated with fish/animal behavior so I left my @gopro to record the fish & sharks and luckily swam back in time to see who was was intrigued by the new #SelfieScreen 🪞 feature on the #Hero9 
Diving in front of our villa @hurawalhi  #hurawalhi #hurawalhimaldives 

Hope this playful video makes you as happy as the encounter made me especially after the grim news yesterday about the possible reversal of protection for sharks in the Maldives. We can’t let that happen so THANK YOU EVERYONE WHO SIGNED THE PETITION IN THE BIOS of: @oceancreature23 & @pelagicdivefuvahmulah or @oneoceanresearch ❤️🦈❤️ If you haven’t yet please sign & share to #HelpSaveSharks #SpeakUpForSharks #savesharks #SaveTheOcean #Playingwithoctopus #funnyoctopus #octopusgopro #octopustakesgopro #sharkpetitionmaldives #sharkconservation #marineconservation

node.text:
#Sharkbite on my camera & the beautiful blue eye of a G R E A T white shark 💙😍 #ApexPredatorNotMonster 
There is a special place in my heart for great white sharks ❤️ Their behavior is absolutely fascinating 😍😍🤓 and like all sharks, they deserve a very high level of respect for their capabilities and important role as predators in their marine ecosystem. 
Grateful to have spent so many years observing their behavior and the behavior of so many species around the world, it’s certainly added a level of respect, awareness, and deep impact to my life’s work and everything that I do. 

#ApexPredatorNotMonster 

Learn more by reading my book “What you should know about sharks” or online course. Links in my bio 💙📖💻

Shooting with @canonusa in an @aquatech_imagingsolutions housing filmed from the @gopro mounted on top of my camera. Ps-major gouges to the dome from the lower jaw but it held up. Cameras are sometimes good deterrent s however sometimes the electronics can stimulate their ampullae of Lorenzini.

node.text:
Life in the natural world is beautiful, life is short, you never know when you will go but I know living for a purpose or cause you’re passionate about brings an incredible depth to life. 
Life might not get easier but if you rise to the challenges and rise again and again you can certainly adapt to become a stronger version of yourself. 

Stay focused on your goals and your passions and respect those who helped you along the way. 
I’ve certainly have had an incredible life, I’ve worked extremely hard with no regret.  I’m grateful for the opportunities and experiences I’ve had and the positive changes I’ve seen because of the choices I made and the wonderful people who have been supportive. 
To those people, I thank you. 

If you’re not sure what your passion or purpose in life is I would encourage you to look into nature conservation, the natural world could use more help and there are many wonderful things about working in natural environments. 

Videos shot by @juansharks & @jarebutter ☺️🙏🙌🏽 @oneoceandiving 

Perfect vid timing because we are seeing so many sandbar and Tiger sharks this time of year @oneoceandiving 😍💙 

If you haven’t experienced sharks make coming out to learn a lot about them and dive with them something on your bucket list @oneoceandiving

node.text:
Sharks are so powerful and important and at the same time their populations are so fragile due to their slow reproductive rates coupled with the exponentially unsustainable rate at which they are being killed. 

Rare species such as these magnificent G r e a t white sharks are targeted in #SharkFishing for their jaws and most all shark species are targeted for their fins for the wasteful, mere status symbol, bowl of soup (that is usually just flavored with beef or chicken broth) called #SharkFinSoup 

A significant portion of sharks are caught and killed daily as part of industrial fishing fleet #bycatch Check out the film @seaspiracy for more information on bycatch and @sirdavidattenborough film #ALifeOnOurPlanet 

Learn more about the beautiful reality and importance of sharks and simultaneously their tragic current plight by watching the film @savingjawsmovie available on @amazonprimevideo and maybe on @youtube and @googleplay Filmed by @juansharks and the also extremely talented director and film maker @keonishoots 

If you want to get involved in conservation efforts for marine life I highly recommend continually sharing your voice for those without a voice.  Help to educate others and bring awareness to issues, but even more, if you can aim to inspire support for actions that lead to furthering protection and saving lives that would make all the difference. 

Thank you to all of those who have been so supportive of my efforts and those of @juansharks and our team @oneoceandiving and One Oceans many divisions: @oneoceanconservation @oneoceaneducation @oneoceanglobal @oneoceanresearch @waterinspired @oneoceanfreediving @oneoceanhawaii @oneoceansharks @oneoceandesigns and @savetheseaturtlesinternational Did I forget any 😄
Thank you to @jarebutter for editing this clip shot with @saltnairstudios shot by @juansharks 
#helpsavesharks #savetheocean #hawaiigreatwhite #greatwhitesharks #divingwithgreatwhitesharks #freediving #sharks #shark #marine #marineconservation #ocean

node.text:
Thank you everyone for the birthday wishes 💕if I haven’t text you back I’m continuously a few thousand text behind (Dms, WhatsApp types & emails are even further 🙈)but mahalo nui loa thank you thank you thank you 🙏 I am so grateful for the many incredible beings who I’ve been fortunate to meet in this life 💙. 
Thank you to everyone who has been supportive of @juansharks and I and our efforts for marine conservation 💕🦈💕 
My hope is that with each year that I continue to live that I will be able to help save more sharks, marine animals, and inspire others to join the effort to do the same. 
 I feel that’s the point of my being here. Sometimes the work I do on land feels…challenging, but what keeps me going is knowing that it ultimately helps to set up and inspire others to do the same: to #HelpSaveSharks and #SaveTheOcean because marine life and future generations need more people to speak up and take action. 
So thank you from the bottom of my ocean heart to those who have are supporting conservation efforts in a small or large way because it all adds up and I know it might mean the difference of if one of my favorite individual sharks, marine animal individual, or even an entire local ecosystem survives another year 💙
Video footage by @juansharks @jarebutter and I
Special ❤️ mahalo to my @juansharks and my local Manō and honu ohana for making my birthday extra special and my @mauidiversjewelry monstera leaf set to remember it by 💙 Photos in stories soon.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Ocean Ramsey #OceanRamsey on August 30, 2021 tagging @theellenshow, @ocean_magazine, @gopro, @owntv, @juansharks, @oceanramsey, @visitqatar, @whalesharks, @fathomlesslife, @discoversharks, @condenasttraveller, @discoverocean, @savetheseaturtlesinternational, @waterinspired, @oneoceanglobal, @gopromaldive, and @discoverqatar. May be an image of whale shark and outdoors.

node.text:
Happy international Whale Shark Day! I LOVE Whale sharks! Please help save these harmless gentle giants please join the effort to spread awareness about the plight of sharks and their dwindling populations due to terrible things like shark finning, bycatch, and entanglement. Join the movement to #HelpSaveSharks by supporting efforts around the world to stop the killing of sharks for their fins for #SharkFinSoup and wasteful practices like #SharkFishing and please, if you eat seafood put in the little extra effort to make sure it’s not coming from industrial commercial fisheries that kill between 7-10 other animals for every one targeted fish they catch (mostly sharks but also sea birds, dolphins, whales, sea turtles, and more.) or go Vegetarian, even just as often as possible :) All efforts add up to positive change and lives saved. 
Wishing you a beautiful day and lifetime of incredible encounters that will be more common if marine species and significant areas are protected 💙 For more ways to #HelpSaveSharks and #SaveTheOcean check out my website. 

#WhaleShark photo by my ❤️🦈 @juansharks

node.text:
Ooooo. My rule of looking around every 10 seconds or less is important when diving with large predatory shark species, but I love I can let my guard down a lot with these mostly harmless nurse sharks.  Watched that frisky ones behavior moving above me and taking the chance to investigate me when my attention was most obviously directed one way. 
Generally I am always looking around to see more behavior, other marine life, and to respectfully scan for the occasional more serious bull, tiger, or reef species that might be coming into the area. 
Very fun diving with @oceanfanatics @sideytheshark at a spot a few minutes away from @reethibeachresort 
Vid shot by my 💙 @Juansharks 

Learn about shark behavior, safety consideration, and conservation in my online course (link on website via bio link) and my book: “What you should know about sharks” only a few left in stock at OneOceanDiving.Com online store with worldwide shipping options, or order via @Amazon where you can find my conservation themed children’s books “The adventures of Shark boy and Ocean girl.” 💙
#SharkDiving #DiscoverSharks #SharkDiver #Sharks #OceanAdventure #learnabout #marinescience #sharkscience #sharkbehavior #freediving #freediver 
Whale shark print wetsuit by @xcelwetsuits #Hammerhead @juansharks signature fins by @cressi

While nurse sharks can cause skin abrasions and cuts or bruises on fingers it’s rare they accidentally suck any skin (or fingers in) and I only know of it happening in provoked situations. 

Vid by @juansharks ❤️

node.text:
Gratitude and Serenity.  Photo by @juansharks diving with @oceanfanaticsmaldives @sideytheshark @reethibeachresort Check out my stories for vids 😍

Feeling a wonderful sense of serenity looking up at these gorgeous, graceful, gentle giants. Manta rays are harmless and defenseless.  Tragically they are quickly heading towards extinction as they are hunted and killed for their gill-rakers for Chinese medicine markets.  Please help save mantas by voting to pass laws or supporting efforts for their protection and marine protected areas. 
Mantas are protected at this incredibly special spot which I am so grateful to be experiencing. Special thanks to @sideytheshark for helping @juansharks and I to make this quick visit since we were already so close in Qatar and @reethibeachresort and @oceanfanaticsmaldives for hosting us and  taking us diving. 🙏  Local research managed by @baaatollbiospherereserve and they’ve got a wonderful team of local rangers keeping an eye out for the mantas & @mantatrust team helping with research 💕💕💕💕💕 

Please comment which photo you like more? The first or 2nd? @juansharks is having a bet with me 😉

node.text:
Qatar is a very rich country and has helped with humanitarian efforts like the recent hosting of the refugees from Afghanistan and peace seeking  meetings with the Taliban a few days ago in the Capital, Doha. 

My personal experience has been that the people here have all been extremely kind and helpful. The two-million migrant workers are able to make more working in Qatar than they would in their home countries and the jobs are heavily sought after. I have a lot of respect for the work ethic here, especially given the occasional up to 120 degree F weather at times. We’ve spent the past few days departing at 4am to go offshore with a wonderful local Qatari whale shark researcher.  Throughout the mid-day heat we’ve looked for whale sharks, possibly the largest aggregation on the planet. It’s a positive side affect of the restrictions on activity in the area that the whale sharks have been left alone for such a long time. 

There are serious issues all around the world, not just in the Middle East, and I wish more people from the United States had perspective for what privileges we have, even if the systems are not perfect, I am so grateful for them and the opportunities I have. 

Don’t believe everything you hear or read in the media about the area it often portrays a extremely negative stereotype and generalization. 

Attitude of gratitude. Grateful for perspective, good conversations, the kindness the locals have shown me, the wonderful people of #Qatar and to have been invited for this quick project in Qatar. More to come. ..but since we are over here on this side of the planet we need to go say Aloha to some friends in Maldives 💕🦈

Currently Qatar requires vaccination and a negative NAAT Covid test result prior to arrival & a PCR test again in the airport upon arrival and they have a contact tracing app that is a requirement for everyone.  Out of respect plan to cover your shoulders down to your knees if you plan to visit the area. 

Special thanks to Liv and the team @DiscoverQatar Liv, our local Guide and whale shark researcher MJ and friends @m_aljaidah 

Photo, not from this trip by my hubby @juansharks 🦈💙 #visitqatar #whalesharksofqatar @visitqatar

node.text:
Will be missing my 🦈 ohana for the next week, heading to the Middle East for a project to document possibly the largest aggregation of #WhaleSharks in the world 🌍 

It’s an honor to have been invited and I hope to learn more about this special population and the culture around them. 

#HelpSaveSharks #ConnectToCare #swimwithsharks #oneocean #careforsharks #ocean #whalesharkswimming #whalesharkwatching #sharksinqatar #qatarsharks #worldcup #worldcup2022 #WhaleSharks #WhaleShark #saveTheOcean 
Footage © @juansharks 💙

#travelforacause #✈️

node.text:
Call me a cleaner fish 🐠 😊

Saved another tiger shark from fishing line with a large tackle swivel ❤️ Was swimming on its side waving its pectoral at me how #SharkIDGador was doing too. Their body language looks like they know my intentions sometime. 

Thank you again to those supporting @oneoceandiving @oneoceanconservation @oneoceanresearch @oneoceanhawaii @savetheseaturtlesinternational 

Special mahalo (thank you) to the amazing crew @oneoceandiving and our shark braddah @inahdm of @pelagicdivefuvahmulah a partner of @oneoceanglobal for being here this week for the start of Tiger season and helping us out. 

Vid credit ❤️ @juansharks 
Conservation benefit wetsuit by @xcelwetsuits releases Spring 2022 ❤️

#HelpSaveSharks 

Fishing line will be reused/recycled for @mano.wahine jewelry line, a conservation project by @oneoceandiving conservation-biologist @andriana_marine Stay tuned for the #sharkID verification @oneoceansharks research project led by @oneoceandiving shark biologist @taylork.sea 💙
#savetheocean #oceanramsey #ocean #discoversharks 

Don’t forget to look around 😉 #SharkSafety

node.text:
To save a shark from fishing gear or entanglement fills me with humble joy! ❤️ If you’ve been out with @oneoceandiving in the last week or two you might’ve seen this beautiful tiger shark #SharkIDGador with fishing line and a bunch of tackle on her. Tiger shark season has just started for us, although we see them year round, there is a significant increase in the # of tigers we see August through October. Tiger shark Gador swam by with around 100ft of line, it took multiple days and multiple tries, sometimes whichever One Ocean boat I was on when she passed by the knife was too rusty for the thick monofilament. The last cut I made this AM in the last clip was to remove the tackle that kept bothering and scarring her as it kept tucking in between her pectoral and side. 
It makes me sad to see the fishing gear bothering them and gouging away at their skin, I’m grateful to the people who have been coming out with us lately which helps facilitate the monitoring of the sharks and gives us a chance to help directly reduce human impacts, injuries, and possible mortality due to entanglement. 
Special thanks to my incredible safety team @oneoceandiving who regularly make great efforts to carefully remove entanglement from every shark they can & @juansharks filming and watching my back, @kylezaj for letting me use your personal knife since all our other ones on the boat were rusted, and my braddah @inahdm from @pelagicdivefuvahmulah of Maldives for being in the right place at the right time so we could be there to save Gador 🙌🏽🤙🏽 
Much gratitude and aloha for all the support from the community and those sharing their experiences with sharks along with an educational conservation minded message ❤️
Fishing line will be recycled and made into jewelry by @oneoceandiving @andriana_marine 

New wetsuit I designed with @xcelwetsuits #SaveTheReef #SaveTheOcean the red wetsuit with the coral design was made for world reef day to raise awareness for coral reefs but due to COVID related delays last year it won’t be released till spring 2022 ❤️ #Mahalo #ThankYou #HelpSaveSharks #RespectSharks #MalamaManō #MarineEntanglement #Discoversharks #xcelwetsuits #oneocean
